journal-title-group.journal-title: The Journal of Financial and Quantitative Analysis

publisher.publisher-name: University of Washington Graduate School of Business Administration

title-group.article-title: Transaction Data Tests of S&P 100 Call Option Pricing

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1991 School of Business Administration, University of Washington

abstract.p: This paper examines the pricing of S&P 100 calls using 14 months of transactions data. We find that market prices of S&P 100 calls differ systematically from Black-Scholes values. The biases in Black-Scholes model prices are both statistically and economically significant and correspond to biases that arise if market prices incorporate a stochastically changing volatility of the index.
